msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 1 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 36; Qurʾānic Text: Q 22:48-22:55; 13 lines per page; Dimensions: 115 x 65mm.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 20: "57 E. H. 36 Kur’an’dan bir yaprak. Parşömen. 65mm boy ve 115mm eninde 1 tek yaprak. Sahifede 87mm uzunl.[uğunda] 13 satır. Hz. ʿAlī hattı ile olduğuna dair kayıt varsa da yazının III. (IX) asırdan evvele ait olamayacağı bariz bir şekilde görünüyor. Etrafına esmer bir kâğıt vassale yapılarak altın zencirek çekilmiştir. Yaprağına yüzünde Ḥacc (22) suresinin 48. ayetinin ortalarından وهى ظالمة ثم أخذتها...... dan başlayarak b. yüzünde 55. ayetin birinci kelimesi olan لا يزال ile bitmektedir. Bu ayetler ayrıca talik hatla kâğıt üzerine yazılarak mahfaza için konmuştur."

This can be translated as follows: "57 E. H. 36. A leaf of the Qurʾān. Parchment. One leaf of 65 mm height and 115 mm width. The text area [contains] 13 lines measuring 87 mm. Even though there is a record states that this was copied by [Caliph] ʿAlī, it was undoubtedly written much later than the 3rd (9th) century. It is surrounded by a gold guilloche (zencirek) with inlaying a brown paper as a vaṣṣālī on its outer covers. The leaf (side a) begins from the middle of the verse Q 22:48 (Sūra al-Ḥacc) وهى ظالمة ثم أخذتها...... and ends (side b) with the first word of the verse [Q 22:]55 لا يزال. These verses were also written on the paper in taʿlīq and enclosed in casing (maḥfaza)."
